Class KMVAttackInflation

  • java.lang.Object
    • KMVAttackInflation

  • public class KMVAttackInflation
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class for the inflation attack included in the paper On the Security of K Minimum Value (KMV) Sketches: Vulnerabilities and Protection P. Reviriego, A. Sánchez-Macián, S. Liu, F. Lombardi It also stores the generated sets in a directory for later additional validations.
    Author:
    Alfonso Sánchez-Macián

      Creates the original set with all the elements and calculates the initial reduced set I by including each element into the sketch and retaining only those that produce an increase in the estimation.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Implements the inflation algorithm from the paper for different cardinalities. Generates Attack sets with a reduced number of elements that, once inserted in a QuickSelect KMV Sketch, are estimated as bigger size sets. Sets are stored to file too.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line arguments. Optional. If present, they should include the value of K and selection between random/sequential values for the initial set. E.g. 1024 seq sets K=1024 and sequential values.

      • validateSet

        private static double[] validateSet(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> aAttack,
                                    org.apache.datasketches.theta.UpdateSketchBuilder builder)
        Insert all the elements from the Attack set into an empty sketch and then calculates the estimation and the number of retained entries in the sketch.
        Parameters:
        aAttack - Attack set as an ArrayList
        builder - Configured element in charge of building the sketch
        Returns:
        two double values corresponding to the estimate and the number of retained entries at the end of the loading process.

      • createSet

        private static final java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> createSet(int finalCardinal,
                                                                     org.apache.datasketches.theta.UpdateSketchBuilder builder,
                                                                     java.util.Random random,
                                                                     boolean rand)
        Creates the original set with all the elements and calculates the initial reduced set I by including each element into the sketch and retaining only those that produce an increase in the estimation.
        Parameters:
        finalCardinal - Initial cardinality of the original set that will be reduced
        builder - Configured element in charge of building the sketch
        random - Generator of the finalCardinal elements in a pseudo-random way
        rand - If true, random parameter is used. Otherwise, sequential integer elements are fed into the initial set.
        Returns:
        Initial reduced set I

      • reduceSet

        public static final java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> reduceSet(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> iAttack,
                                                                    org.apache.datasketches.theta.UpdateSketchBuilder builder)
        Creates a more reduced Attack set A from the initial reduced set I by reversing the set, including each element into the sketch and retaining only those that produce an increase in the estimation.
        Parameters:
        iAttack - Initial attack set as an ArrayList that will be further reduced.
        builder - Configured element in charge of building the sketch
        Returns:
        Attack set A
